Icons

Utility Classes

There are two options for using icons, either as an inline svg with the use tag, or as a utility class that sets the background image of the icon (bg-). The tradeoff for both cases is that you can change the color of inline svg icon shapes that have their fill set as currentColor. Icons with background images require less markup and their shape fill color will default to black or whatever fill color the shape is set to.

To use the inline svgs, include the icon symbol in your page markup. This can be found in this repositories source under ./src/views/partials/icons.slm.

icon-logo #icon-logo,
bg-icon-logo
<svg class="icon-logo text-base-black">
  <use xlink:href="#icon-logo">
</svg>
 
<div class="bg-icon-logo"></div>
icon-logo-nyc #icon-logo-nyc,
bg-icon-logo-nyc
<svg class="icon-logo-nyc text-base-black">
  <use xlink:href="#icon-logo-nyc">
</svg>
 
<div class="bg-icon-logo-nyc"></div>

NYC Opportunity is the New York City Mayor's Office for Economic Opportunity. We are committed to sharing open source software that we use in our products. Feel free to ask questions and share feedback. Follow @nycopportunity on  Twitter,  Facebook,  Medium, and  Github.
